<!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 90221 |area_code = [[Area code 310|310]]/[[Area code 424|424]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 06-20550 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 1867014 |website = |footnotes = }} '''East Rancho Dominguez''', also known as '''East Compton''', is an [[unincorporated community]] and [[census-designated place]] (CDP) located in southern [[Los Angeles County, California]]. The population was 15,135 at the 2010 census, up from 9,286 at the 2000 census. East Rancho Dominguez is an accepted city name according to the [[United States Postal Service|USPS]], and shares the 90221 [[ZIP Code]] with [[Compton, California|Compton]].<ref>[http://zip4.usps.com/zip4/zcl_3_results.jsp http://zip4.usps.com/zip4/zcl_3_results.jsp] ''zip4.usps.com''</ref>
East Rancho Dominguez is an unincorporated [[enclave]] surrounded by [[Compton, California|Compton]] within five blocks east and west of [[Atlantic Boulevard (Los Angeles County)|Atlantic Ave.]]. Alondra Blvd. is the southern border, and three blocks north of Rosecrans Ave. is roughly the northern border. ''East Rancho Dominguez County Park'' is in the center of the community.
To the north is the city of [[Lynwood, California|Lynwood]]. To the east is the [[Long Beach Freeway]], the [[Los Angeles River]], and then the city of [[Paramount, California|Paramount]]. To the south and southeast is the city of [[Long Beach, California|Long Beach]].
Its [[sphere of influence]] is the city of Compton, which has tried to annex East Rancho Dominguez, but business and property owners in the area have opposed the annexation.<ref> [http://www.thecomptonbulletin.com/news04_012506/index.html http://www.thecomptonbulletin.com/news04_012506/index.html] ''thecomptonbulletin.com''</ref><ref>[http://www.lalafco.org/Agendas/2006/030806a.pdf#search=%22%22East%20Rancho%20Dominguez%22%20Compton%22 http://www.lalafco.org/Agendas/2006/030806a.pdf#search=%22%22East%20Rancho%20Dominguez%22%20Compton%22] ''lalatco.org''</ref> <!-- LOCAL AGENCY FORMATION COMMISSION REGULAR MEETING AGENDA 3/8/2006-->
[[Rancho Dominguez, California|Rancho Dominguez]] is a separate unincorporated, mostly industrial area south of the city of Compton.
==Geography== East Compton is located at {{coord|33|53|52|N|118|11|39|W|type:city}} (33.897748, -118.194093).{{GR|1}}
According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of {{convert|0.8|sqmi|km2}}, all land.
==Demographics== {{USCensusPop | 1970=5853 | 1980=6435 | 1990=7967 | 2000=9286 | 2010=15135 | footnote=sources:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.census.gov/prod/www/abs/decennial/index.html |title=CENSUS OF POPULATION AND HOUSING (1790-2000) |publisher=[[U.S. Census Bureau]] |accessdate=2010-07-17}}</ref><ref name="census1">[http://factfinder2.census.gov/faces/tableservices/jsf/pages/productview.xhtml?pid=DEC_10_PL_GCTPL1.ST13&prodType=table US Census Bureau]</ref> }} ===2010=== The [[2010 United States Census]]<ref>{{USCensus-2010CA}}</ref> reported that East Rancho Dominguez had a population of 15,135. The [[population density]] was 18,412.3 people per square mile (7,109.0/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of East Rancho Dominguez was 4,774 (31.5%) [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 2,404 (15.9%) [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 133 (0.9%) [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 33 (0.2%) [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 109 (0.7%) [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 7,156 (47.3%) from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 526 (3.5%) from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 12,407 persons (82.0%).
The Census reported that 14,946 people (98.8% of the population) lived in households, 183 (1.2%) lived in non-institutionalized group quarters, and 6 (0%) were institutionalized.
There were 2,996 households, out of which 2,036 (68.0%) had children under the age of 18 living in them, 1,626 (54.3%) were [[marriage|opposite-sex married couples]] living together, 739 (24.7%) had a female householder with no husband present, 302 (10.1%) had a male householder with no wife present. There were 228 (7.6%) [[POSSLQ|unmarried opposite-sex partnerships]], and 24 (0.8%) [[same-sex partnerships|same-sex married couples or partnerships]]. 228 households (7.6%) were made up of individuals and 74 (2.5%) had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 4.99. There were 2,667 [[family (U.S. Census)|families]] (89.0% of all households); the average family size was 4.96.
The population was spread out with 5,311 people (35.1%) under the age of 18, 1,966 people (13.0%) aged 18 to 24, 4,297 people (28.4%) aged 25 to 44, 2,755 people (18.2%) aged 45 to 64, and 806 people (5.3%) who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 26.1 years. For every 100 females there were 98.0 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 96.9 males.
There were 3,186 housing units at an average density of 3,875.9 per square mile (1,496.5/kmÂ²), of which 1,638 (54.7%) were owner-occupied, and 1,358 (45.3%) were occupied by renters. The homeowner vacancy rate was 3.3%; the rental vacancy rate was 5.1%. 8,824 people (58.3% of the population) lived in owner-occupied housing units and 6,122 people (40.4%) lived in rental housing units.
===2000=== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 9,286 people, 1,849 households, and 1,669 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 17,945.9 inhabitants per square mile (6,894.9/kmÂ²). There were 1,945 housing units at an average density of 3,758.9 per square mile (1,444.2/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the CDP was 24.69% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 19.83% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.70% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 0.15% [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], 1.17% [[Race (United States Census)|Pacific Islander]], 50.23% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 3.23% from two or more races. 77.15% of the population were [[Hispanics in the United States|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race. [[Image:Comption-1920.jpg|thumb|left|Aerial view of Compton, 1920.]] There were 1,849 households out of which 62.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 59.5% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 22.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 9.7% were non-families. 7.5% of all households were made up of individuals and 2.5% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 5.01 and the average family size was 4.97.
In the CDP the population was spread out with 39.8% under the age of 18, 12.9% from 18 to 24, 30.3% from 25 to 44, 13.5% from 45 to 64, and 3.5% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 24 years. For every 100 females there were 99.9 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 99.4 males.
The median income for a household in the CDP was $31,398, and the median income for a family was $30,160. Males had a median income of $20,573 versus $20,240 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $8,108. About 31.6% of families and 36.7% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 48.2% of those under age 18 and 19.7% of those age 65 or over.<ref>[http://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/SAFFFacts?_event=Search&geo_id=16000US0620550&_geoContext=01000US%7C04000US06%7C16000US0620550&_street=&_county=East+Rancho+Dominquez&_cityTown=East+Rancho+Dominquez&_state=04000US06&_zip=&_lang=en&_sse=on&ActiveGeoDiv=geoSelect&_useEV=&pctxt=fph&pgsl=160&_submenuId=factsheet_1&ds_name=DEC_2000_SAFF&_ci_nbr=null&qr_name=null&reg=null%3Anull&_keyword=&_industry= http://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/SAFFFacts?_event=Search&geo_id=16000US0620550&_geoContext=01000US%7C04000US06%7C16000US0620550&_street=&_county=East+Rancho+Dominquez&_cityTown=East+Rancho+Dominquez&_state=04000US06&_zip=&_lang=en&_sse=on&ActiveGeoDiv=geoSelect&_useEV=&pctxt=fph&pgsl=160&_submenuId=factsheet_1&ds_name=DEC_2000_SAFF&_ci_nbr=null&qr_name=null&reg=null%3Anull&_keyword=&_industry=] ''factfinder.census.gov''</ref>
==Politics== In the [[California State Legislature|state legislature]] East Rancho Dominguez is located in the 25th [[California State Senate|Senate]] District, represented by Democrat [[Edward Vincent]], and in the 52nd [[California State Assembly|Assembly]] District, represented by Democrat [[Isadore Hall, III]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://asmdc.org/members/a52/ |title=Assemblymember Isadore Hall Representing the 52nd Assembly District |publisher=Asmdc.org |date= |accessdate=2011-06-02}}</ref> Federally, East Rancho Dominguez is located in [[California's 37th congressional district]], which has a [[Cook Partisan Voting Index|Cook PVI]] of D +27<ref>{{cite web | title = Will Gerrymandered Districts Stem the Wave of Voter Unrest? | publisher = Campaign Legal Center Blog | url=http://www.clcblog.org/blog_item-85.html | accessdate = 2008-02-10}}</ref> and is represented by Democrat [[Laura Richardson]].
==Schools== *[[El Camino College Compton Center]] *[[Compton Unified School District]]
==Parks and recreation== Originally East Compton Park, East Rancho Dominguez Park was completely renovated in 2004 to become one of the most appealing recreational facilities in the South County Community Services Agency. The five-acre park includes a well equipped gymnasium, ample community building, and the tennis courts where [[Venus Williams]] and [[Serena Williams]] played as children. The park has year-round recreational programs including youth sports, adult basketball leagues, the âAmp It Up!â summer lunch program, after-school snacks, and summer and after-school day camps.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lacountyparks.org/Parkinfo.asp?URL=cms1_033397.asp&Title=East%20Rancho%20Dominguez%20Park |title=Los Angeles County Parks and Rec > East Rancho Dominguez Park |publisher=Lacountyparks.org |date= |accessdate=2011-06-02}}</ref>
